volume1_ch2_tri_unity: Tri-Unity provides the evaluation and projection backbone (ΠΦδ) needed to recognize and stabilize FSMs.
volume1_ch4_mu: μ defines the local metric, which controls the amplitude and stability of FSMs.
volume1_ch6_lambda: λ defines curvature wells that can confine oscillations into FSMs.
volume1_ch7_psi: The Semantic Wave Equation defines the dynamical basis for FSM oscillations.
volume1_ch8_sigma: Σ defines the normal form mechanism that either collapses or preserves candidate FSMs.
volume2_ch2_attractors: FSMs that satisfy additional stability constraints become full semantic attractors.
volume2_ch3_proto_forces: FSMs inside λ/μ fields are the seeds for proto-force mediation and interaction networks.
